description:
Enables you to get aggregated metrics from instances, such as `total_cost` or `lowest_instance_count`.

Both HTTP GET and HTTP POST requests can be used to execute these actions. Since we do not limit the number
of filters applied it is possible that the URL may exceed the maximum length. If the URL length is over
2,083 characters we recommend using a POST request with the parameters in the body.

actions.description:
Calculates the overall metrics for instance usages in a time period, e.g. show me the
          total cost of all my instances during the last month.
actions.name: overall

timezone.description: The timezone name. Accepts any valid tz timezone (`http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones`).

start_time.description: The start time of the period.

end_time.description: The end time of the period.

metrics.description: The metrics to get results for. Descriptions of the individual metrics can be found in the Metrics media type.

bad_request.description: The request cannot be fulfilled due to bad syntax.

ok.description: Standard response for successful HTTP requests.

actions.description:
Calculates the overall metrics for instance usages in a time period and groups them into
          specified breakdown categories, e.g. show me the total cost of all my instances during the
          last month grouped by different accounts.
actions.name: grouped_overall

timezone.description: The timezone name. Accepts any valid tz timezone (`http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones`).

start_time.description: The start time of the period.

end_time.description: The end time of the period.

metrics.description: The metrics to get results for. Descriptions of the individual metrics can be found in the Metrics media type.

group.description: The fields to group the results by.

order.description: The fields to order the results by. If '-' is in front of the field name allows it to be sorted in descending order.

offset.description: Used with limit to paginate the results.

bad_request.description: The request cannot be fulfilled due to bad syntax.

ok.description: Standard response for successful HTTP requests.

actions.description:
Calculates the metrics time series for instance usages in a time period allowing different
          time buckets (hour, 3 days, month, etc.), e.g. show me the lowest instance count of my
          instances per day during the last month.
actions.name: time_series

timezone.description: The timezone name. Accepts any valid tz timezone (`http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones`).

start_time.description: The start time of the period.

end_time.description: The end time of the period.

metrics.description: The metrics to get results for. Descriptions of the individual metrics can be found in the Metrics media type.

granularity.description:
The time bucket to group the results by, e.g. if the granularity is 'day' there will be a
TimeSeriesMetricResult returned for each day during the requested period. An hourly granularity can only
be used for a date range up to 1 month and a daily granularity can only be used for a date range up to 2
years.

interval.description: The interval for the time bucket to group the results by, e.g. if the granularity is day and the interval is 2 then the results will be grouped into buckets representing a period of 2 days.

bad_request.description: The request cannot be fulfilled due to bad syntax.

ok.description: Standard response for successful HTTP requests.

actions.description:
Calculates the metrics time series for instance usages in a time period allowing different
          time buckets (hour, 3 days, month, etc.) and groups them into specified breakdown
          categories, e.g. show me the lowest instance count of my instances per day during the last
          month grouped by accounts.
actions.name: grouped_time_series

timezone.description: The timezone name. Accepts any valid tz timezone (`http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones`).

start_time.description: The start time of the period.

end_time.description: The end time of the period.

metrics.description: The metrics to get results for. Descriptions of the individual metrics can be found in the Metrics media type.

granularity.description:
The time bucket to group the results by, e.g. if the granularity is 'day' there will be a
TimeSeriesMetricResult returned for each day during the requested period. An hourly granularity can only
be used for a date range up to 1 month and a daily granularity can only be used for a date range up to 2
years.

interval.description: The interval for the time bucket to group the results by, e.g. if the granularity is day and the interval is 2 then the results will be grouped into buckets representing a period of 2 days.

group.description: The fields to group the results by.

order.description: The fields to order the results by. If '-' is in front of the field name allows it to be sorted in descending order.

offset.description: Used with limit to paginate the results.

bad_request.description: The request cannot be fulfilled due to bad syntax.

ok.description: Standard response for successful HTTP requests.

actions.description: Returns the count of currently running instances.
actions.name: current_count

bad_request.description: The request cannot be fulfilled due to bad syntax.

ok.description: Standard response for successful HTTP requests.

name: V1::ApiResources::InstanceMetrics
